script-type.name: timer
script-type.blurb: A variable meant to represent time. It can be set to count up or down.

method.name: is_zero
method.blurb: Checks whether the timer's value is zero.
method.example: -- -- A common use of timers is to announce the gametype name at the -- start of a round, by "sending an incident" a few seconds after -- script processing begins. -- alias announced_start = player.number[0] alias announced_timer = player.timer[0] declare player.announced_timer = 5 -- for each player do if current_player.announced_start == 0 then current_player.announced_timer.set_rate(-100%) if current_player.announced_timer.is_zero() then current_player.announced_start = 1 send_incident(action_sack_game_start, current_player, no_player) end end end

method.name: set_rate

args.arg:
The rate and direction at which the timer should advance. Positive values will make the timer's value increase away from zero, while negative values will make the timer's value decrease to (but not past) zero. You may use any of the following rates (prefixed with a minus sign for negative values):
0%
10%
25%
50%
75%
100%
125%
150%
175%
200%
300%
400%
500%
1000%

method.blurb: Set the rate and direction in which the timer advances.
method.example: -- -- A common use of timers is to announce the gametype name at the -- start of a round, by "sending an incident" a few seconds after -- script processing begins. -- alias announced_start = player.number[0] alias announced_timer = player.timer[0] declare player.announced_timer = 5 -- for each player do if current_player.announced_start == 0 then current_player.announced_timer.set_rate(-100%) if current_player.announced_timer.is_zero() then current_player.announced_start = 1 send_incident(action_sack_game_start, current_player, no_player) end end end
